pullRequest.body:
- [x] Add generalised version of `top_pow` in `Algebra/Order/Ring/WithTop`
- [x] Add specialised version of `top_pow` in `Data/ENat/Basic.lean`
- [x] Add specialised version of `top_pow` in `Data/ENNReal/Operations.lean` 

Co-authored by @D-Thomine.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3c47733246](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14019/commits/3c47733246813fb831d66ee01a468825bcdb9a93)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`-+++ top_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Ok, I should have addressed all the review requests. 

Thank you very much @sgouezel for your review!

In fact, this should be generalized to `WithTop`. Could you take the proof from `ENNReal.top_pow` and move it to `Algebra.Order.Ring.WithTop` at Line 170 (and then restate `ENNReal.top_pow` and `ENat.top_pow` as specialized versions of the general statement?)

I should have addressed all the review requests: 

- [x] Add generalised version of `top_pow` in `Algebra/Order/Ring/WithTop`
- [x] Add specialised version of `top_pow` in `Data/ENat/Basic.lean`
- [x] Add specialised version of `top_pow` in `Data/ENNReal/Operations.lean` 

Thank you @sgouezel for your review.
My comment was to copy the proof of `ENNReal.top_pow` because it is better than the proof of the current PR. The comment still stands :-)

Now I should have addressed all the review requests. 

Thank you very much @sgouezel for your review!

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9649318523/job/26612531007)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9649318523/job/26612530713)

When the steps of the computation are trivial, it's often better to just use `simp`, like
```suggestion
  apply Nat.le_induction (P := fun m : ℕ ↦ fun _ : 1 ≤ m ↦ (⊤ : ℕ∞) ^ m = ⊤) (pow_one ⊤) _ _ n_pos
  intro m _ h
  simp only [pow_add, h, pow_one]
  exact WithTop.top_mul_top
```
no #align for new statements. It's only useful for statements that were already existing in Lean 3, for porting tools.
ditto
The "no #align for new statements" also applies here. That's the meaning of "ditto".
Yes, I know. I've removed it, right?

No, I did not... sorry. 

Done now.

```suggestion
theorem top_pow {n : ℕ} (n_pos : 0 < n) : (⊤ : WithTop α) ^ n = ⊤ := by
```
Spaces in power operation, here and elsewhere in the PR.
In ENNReal, the notation ∞ is preferred.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Order/Ring/WithTop): add generalised and specialised power of top
